column1: Lesozavodsk (Russian: Лесозаво́дск) is a town in Primorsky Krai
column3: located on the Ussuri River (Amur's tributary)
column4: 10 kilometers (6.2 mi) from the Sino–Russian border and about 300 kilometers (190 mi) north of Vladivostok
column5: the administrative center of the krai. Population: 37

column1: The first settlement on the site was founded in 1924 in connection with a sawmill. The settlement was originally named Dalles (Дальлес)
column2: from the Russian word dalny for "distant" (referring to the Russian Far East) and les for "forest". In 1932
column3: Dalles was merged with the nearby village of Novostroyka
column4: granted urban-type settlement status and renamed Lesozavodsk. Lesozavodsk was granted town status in 1938.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column4: incorporated as Lesozavodsk Town Under Krai Jurisdiction—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: Lesozavodsk Town Under Krai Jurisdiction is incorporated as Lesozavodsky Urban Okrug.

column1: Ruzhino railway station of the Trans-Siberian Railway is located in Lesozavodsk. The M60 Highway between Khabarovsk and Vladivostok passes about 10 kilometers (6.2 mi) east of the town.
The 130th Machine Gun Artillery Division of the 5th Army
column2: Far Eastern Military District was based here until 2009 or 2010
column3: when it became a motorized rifle brigade and then a storage base.

column1: Lesozavodsk has a humid continental climate with cold and dry winters
column4: due to the Southeast Asian monsoons.

column1: Законодательное Собрание Приморского края. Закон №161-КЗ от 14 ноября 2001 г. «Об административно-территориальном устройстве Приморского края»
column2: в ред. Закона №673-КЗ от 6 октября 2015 г. «О внесении изменений в Закон Приморского края "Об административно-территориальном устройстве Приморского края"». Вступил в силу со дня официального опубликования. Опубликован: "Красное знамя Приморья"
column4: 29 ноября 2001 г. (Legislative Assembly of Primorsky Krai. Law #161-KZ of November 14
column5: 2001 On the Administrative-Territorial Structure of Primorsky Krai
column6: as amended by the Law #673-KZ of October 6
column7: 2015 On Amending the Law of Primorsky Krai "On the Administrative-Territorial Structure of Primorsky Krai". Effective as of the official publication date.).

column1: Законодательное Собрание Приморского края. Закон №181-КЗ от 6 декабря 2004 г. «О Лесозаводском городском округе». Вступил в силу со дня официального опубликования. Опубликован: "Ведомости Законодательного Собрания Приморского края"
column3: 7 декабря 2004 г. (Legislative Assembly of Primorsky Krai. Law #181-KZ of December 6
